newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's electricity utility to invests $255 mln.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's electricity utility to invests $255 mln.

text.p: Morocco's state-owned electricity utility, Office National de l'Electricite (ONE), said on Thursday it would invest 2.5 billion dirhams ($255 million) in its distribution network for 1997-1999.
The work aims mainly at linking up production centres and reinforcing the grid associated with the connection between Morocco and Spain, an ONE spokesman said.
"We plan to implement the third stage of the Moroccan-Spanish power connection during 1997-1999," he added during a meeting with power specialists.
This work would involve 220 km (135 miles) of power line, he said.
Morocco and Spain have been working on linking their power grids via a power line across the Strait of Gibraltar.
The environmental group Greenpeace has accused Spain of seeking to export its excess electricity to Morocco rather than cut back production of "dirty" energy from coal and nuclear plants.
